heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 12 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 11th since our records started in 23 September 2024.  There have been 5 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 09 September 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (193°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 1.6°C) and feels like temperature (down 1.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 10%) and rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 10890 lux) and cloud levels (up 763 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 12829 lux), rainfall (down 0.1 mm), and cloud levels (up 1223 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 762.6m lower than yesterday, 782.5m lower than the past week, 1223.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 939m to a maximum of 3180m, averaging 1023.7m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1806.2m and 2250m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and the light is absent. Changeable conditions.
